intro: Anettea curta, commonly known as the short anettea, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere, particularly in parts of Europe and Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 20 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, which is a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Anettea curta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
